etymology.description: Depicts a person standing on the ground
etymology.interpretation: The character 立(立) (lì, 'stand') intuitively represents the concept of standing by depicting a person in an upright position, emphasizing the posture.

examples.chinese: 小王立在窗前(小王立在窗前)，等待朋友到来(等待朋友到來)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo Wáng lì zài chuāng qián, děngdài péngyǒu dàolái.
examples.english: Xiao Wang stands at the window, waiting for his friend to arrive.

examples.chinese: 园中雕像静立于石台上(園中雕像靜立於石臺上)。
examples.pinyin: Yuán zhōng diāoxiàng jìng lì yú shí tái shàng.
examples.english: The statue in the garden stands quietly on the stone platform.

examples.chinese: 士兵集合后(士兵集合後)，整齐地立定阵型(整齊地立定陣型)。
examples.pinyin: Shìbīng jíhé hòu, zhěngqí de lì dìng zhènxíng.
examples.english: After the soldiers assemble, they stand in formation neatly.
